function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased urbanization despite the advice to expand horizontally and decrease densities may lead to higher risk of disease spread in crowded areas.","Impact":"Higher risk of disease spread and potential inability to control outbreaks effectively.","Mitigation":"Encourage planned urban expansion with a focus on decentralization and smaller units to reduce population density.","Technologies":"Urban planning and zoning regulations to guide development patterns.","People":"Residents of crowded urban areas, particularly in cities.","Owner":"Urban planners and government authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of emphasis on walkable and cyclable urban environments may lead to continued reliance on cars, increasing pollution and health risks.","Impact":"Increased pollution, negative impact on physical and mental health, and environmental degradation.","Mitigation":"Promote infrastructure for walkable and cyclable urban environments, including pedestrian and cycling paths.","Technologies":"Green transportation technology, urban design, and infrastructure development.","People":"Urban residents and commuters.","Owner":"Local governments and urban development authorities."},{"Description":"Inadequate planning for emergency facility requirements and medical infrastructure may result in insufficient response to future outbreaks.","Impact":"Difficulty in meeting healthcare facility demands during quarantine times and emergency situations.","Mitigation":"Develop robust strategies for adaptive reuse of existing structures for emergency facilities and streamline modular construction processes for rapid response.","Technologies":"Modular construction, prefabricated components, and adaptive reuse technologies.","People":"Residents in need of emergency medical facilities.","Owner":"Healthcare authorities and emergency response agencies."}]}
